contest-event.event-date:
Nov. 29, 1884 D Derby Contest
Derby Contest 0 Own Choice Test Piece Contest
derby-contest
None
Drill Hall, Derby Electro-plated "Champion" Cornet, in leather case, value £8.8s, presented by the makers, Messrs. R. J. Ward and Sons, Liverpool, to the band having the best cornet and soprano players - Besses o' th' Barn. B flat Euphonium, value £10. 10s, by Silvani and Smith, London, to the band having the best performer on the euphonium, Besses o' th' Barn.
An Electro-plated B flat Slide Trombone, with water key, value £6 6s., presented by Messrs. Henry Keat and Sons, London, to the band having the best performer on the slide trombone, Besses o' th' Barn. An Ivory Silver-mounted Baton, value £2 10s., presented by Messrs. Silvani and Smith, London, to the best amateur at this contest, Mr. Bonser, Hucknall United. 9 bands competed
Dec. 29, 2011, 9:38 a.m. Aug. 16, 2019, 1:06 p.m.
1 Besses o' th' Barn Alexander Owen La Gazza Ladra [arr. Godfrey]
2 Littleborough Band Edwin Swift Operatic Selection [unknown arranger]
3 Burslem Band Richard Sourbutts Un Ballo in Maschera [unknown arranger]
4 Denby Dale Brass John Gladney Jnr Souvenir de Meyerbeer [arr. Godfrey]
Unknown Result South Notts Silver George Hames Weber Fantasia [arr. Gladney]
Unknown Result Old Silkstone Coniah Stringer Le Prophete [arr. Winterbottom]
Unknown Result Chesterfield and Hasland W. Mountney Atilla [unknown arranger]
Unknown Result Sutton and Hucknall United A. Howard Bonser Les Huguenots [unknown arranger]
Unknown Result South Wingfield W. Parkinson Joan of Arc [Round]
